DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis based on cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A position in relation to its surroundings.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
